div.l: He was as ful of loue and ꝑparamoᵘur
As is þe hive ful of hony swete
Wel was þe wenche wiþ him might mete
At eủery brideale wolde he singe and hoppe
He louede bet þe tauerne þan the shoppe
For whan þer any ridyng was in chepe
Out of þe shoppe þider wolde he lepe
Til þat he had al the sight I seyn
And daunced wel wolde he not come ageyn
And gadered him a meyne of his sorte
To hoppe and singe and maken swich disporte
And þ̉ere þei setten steuen for to mete
To pleyen at dis in suche a strete
For in þe toun̄ nas þ̉er no prentise
That faire couþe cast a paire of dice
Than ꝑperken couþe and þ̉erto he was fre
Of his dispence in place of priuete
That fonde his maister wel in his cheffare
For oft tyme he fonde his box ful bare
For sikerly a prentis Reuelour
That haunteþ dis / riot or ꝑparamoᵘur
His maistre shal it in his shoppe abie
Al haue he not part of þe menstracie
For þeft and riot þei ben cōnuertible
Al konne he plaie on giterne or Rubible
Reuel and trouþe as in a lough degre
Thei ben ful wroþe alday as men mai se
This Ioly prentis with his maistre bode
Til he were nygh out of his prentishode
Al were he snybbed boþen erli and late
And somtyme lad with reuel to neugate
But atte last his maister him beþouȝt
Vpon a dai whan he his paper sought
Of a prouerbe þat seith þis same wor
